article.headline: Buffalo 72, St. Peter's 65
article.story: BUFFALO, N.Y. -- Javon McCrea scored 18 points to lead four Buffalo players in double figures as the Bulls held off Saint Peter's 72-65 on Friday night in the season opener for both teams. Dave Barnett scored 13, Mitchell Watt had 12 and Zach Filzen added 11 for Buffalo. The Bulls led by as many as 14 in the first half, building the lead to 52-34 with 12:27 to play, Paced by Chris Prescott with 23 points, Saint Peter's chipped away, cutting the margin to 65-61 with 53 seconds to play. Buffalo hit 7 of 8 from the free-throw line from that point to hold on as the Peacocks made only 1 of 5 field goals. Both teams finished 20-14 last season. The Bulls, who lead the series 3-0, won the last meeting 77-75 in overtime on a buzzer beater in an ESPN BracketBusters game on Feb. 20, 2010.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
